definition: As part of the ESP system, Active Rollover Protection (ARP) recognises an impending rollover and rapidly applies braking to selective wheels to reduce the likelihood of an accident.
Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC) uses radar sensors to maintain a set distance from the vehicle ahead by automatically adjusting your speed. It enhances driving comfort, especially on long journeys.
Volkswagen-approved accessories are available for purchase and fitting at your Van Centre. They are designed to perfectly match your vehicle in fit and style, ensuring durability and reliability.
The Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) prevents the wheels from locking during braking, maintaining steering control and reducing stopping distances on slippery surfaces.
App-Connect allows you to connect your smartphone to the vehicle's infotainment system via USB, enabling you to use selected apps safely while driving.
BlueMotion models represent Volkswagen's commitment to reducing emissions and improving fuel efficiency through aerodynamic design, low rolling resistance tires, and efficient engines.
The Brake Assist System (BAS) detects emergency braking situations and increases brake pressure to help reduce stopping distances.
A bulkhead is a partition that separates the driver and passenger area from the cargo area in a van, enhancing safety and security.
Car-Net is Volkswagen's suite of connected services, providing features like real-time traffic information, remote vehicle status, and more.
City Emergency Braking is a system that helps prevent low-speed collisions by automatically applying the brakes if an imminent collision is detected.
DAB+ is an upgraded version of Digital Audio Broadcasting, offering clearer sound quality and a wider range of radio stations.
Daytime Running Lights are automatically activated lights that improve the visibility of your vehicle during daylight hours.
A Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) captures and stores exhaust soot to reduce emissions from diesel engines.
The Direct Shift Gearbox (DSG) is an automatic transmission that pre-selects gears for quick and smooth gear changes.
A double cab refers to a vehicle configuration with two rows of seats, providing additional seating capacity.
The Driver Alert system monitors driving behavior and warns the driver if signs of fatigue are detected.
A dropside is a flatbed vehicle with hinged side panels that can be lowered for easy loading and unloading.
The Electronic Differential Lock (EDL) helps improve traction by braking a spinning wheel, transferring power to the wheel with more grip.
The Electronic Stabilisation Program (ESP) enhances vehicle stability by detecting and reducing loss of traction.
Emissions standards are regulations that set limits on the amount of pollutants a vehicle can emit.
Engine Braking Control (EBC) prevents the wheels from locking due to engine braking on slippery surfaces by increasing engine speed.
A Kombi is a versatile vehicle configuration that combines passenger seating with cargo space.
Lane Change Assist, also known as Side Scan, monitors the blind spots and warns the driver of approaching vehicles during lane changes.
Passive safety refers to features that protect occupants during a collision, such as airbags and crumple zones.
Payload refers to the maximum weight of cargo and passengers that a vehicle can safely carry.
A pick-up is a light-duty truck with an enclosed cab and an open cargo area with low sides and tailgate.
A rear-view camera provides a live video feed of the area behind the vehicle to assist with reversing and parking.
The Stop/Start system automatically shuts down and restarts the engine to reduce idling time, improving fuel economy and reducing emissions.
TDI stands for Turbocharged Direct Injection, Volkswagen's diesel engine technology known for efficiency and performance.
A tipper is a truck with a cargo bed that can be tilted to unload its contents.
The Traction Control System (TCS) prevents wheel spin during acceleration by reducing engine power or applying brakes to individual wheels.
Volkswagen Crafter conversions refer to customized adaptations of the Crafter model to suit specific business needs.
4MOTION is Volkswagen's all-wheel-drive system that provides improved traction and stability across various driving conditions.
